column5: HA! what an awesom episode. hope to be down in the keys in a few weeks...  Pete had his hands full with that big Goliath. I hooked one off 7 mile bridge and it kicked my ass!
Sweet, By Goliath you mean grouper? Those fish are huge. Watched a episode on them before snapped the dude's rod like nothing. Crazy fish.
there is an awesome one called Chew on this .. google it, awesome too see
<object width="425" height="350"><param name="movie" value="
That was unreal!!! talk about monsters. Thanks for posting that. Worth every second to view.
thats the one Rick.. any fish that makes you sream like a girl is good in my books
Or his Undies are too tight ,might explain his shreiking
Wow...unbelieveable footage!  Probably pull me right in the water!! Thanks Rick.
that is ture and when its hot it gets really uncomfortable
thanks rick...thats some amazing footage for sure..  .those fish are huge,i think they would pull an unsuspecting angler right into the water....WOW
He laughs like the freak from Fish 'n' 4 wheels.
i would be thrilled to get down there for some fishing, Pete you need any guest for a show
Great day had by all right.  I have to get south again some day.   Great show.  Thanks   Bob
here is a monster caught from shore
How big was that one Crazyhook??  I caught a 300 pounder in 1978 in the Gulf of Mexico.  What a battle from 300 feet down.   Bob
Those were incredible!!   You just can't go wrong around docks; It's a universal traesure trove!  Wonder how they taste?
Robert, i did not catch that one but it was estimated to be around 500 pounds  Snag Goliath grouper are a protected species and have to be released

Back in 78 they were sold at the docks to resturants for 25 cents a pound hanging weight.  I'd never kill anothe rfish like that on purpose but coming up from that deep they die.  I don't like killing anything anymore.  Catch and release is my thing now.  Good Fishing Bob
Those are some nice Goliath Groupers!  Here is another chew on this episode and this fish is supposed to be 500 lbs this is INTENSE!  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J_it62G0QnA

Heya Bob! Now we can chat on 3 sites!!! For those that don't know Mr. Brunner, he has 78 years experience on the water and is a true legend Down here on Lk. St. Cair in US waters and Canadian. We all can learn alot from Him. Welcome to the site Bob!   Are you gonna get out on the ice with Greg still?
